name: Gaufre
short_description: Deliciously fragrant, Belgian gaufres are iconic waffles crafted from thick dough, resulting in a crispy exterior and fluffy interior. Enjoy them warm, dusted with powdered sugar or topped with fresh fruit.

name: Moules-frites
short_description: Savory mussels, steamed to perfection with garlic and onions, are served alongside crispy Belgian fries. A beloved comfort food in Belgium, it's a must-try for seafood lovers!

name: Carbonnade
short_description: A Belgian classic, this hearty beef stew simmers slowly in rich Trappist beer, infusing tender meat with deep flavors of onion, garlic, and carrot. Perfect for warming up on cold days!

name: Liège Waffle
short_description: Originating from Belgium, Liège waffles feature a rich, brioche-like dough studded with crunchy pearl sugar that caramelizes as they bake. Each bite offers a delightful chewiness and sweet, buttery flavor.

name: Frikandel
short_description: Skinless and deep-fried, this beloved snack bursts with flavors of ground beef, pork, and chicken, accented by warm allspice and nutmeg. A culinary icon of Belgium, it sparks friendly debate with its Dutch counterpart.

name: Speculaas
short_description: Spiced and aromatic, these traditional Belgian cookies blend wheat flour, butter, and brown sugar for a warm, crunchy treat. Perfect with coffee, they invoke the festive spirit of the season.

name: Brussels Waffles
short_description: Light and airy, these yeasted delights capture the essence of Belgium’s culinary heritage. Golden-brown and crisp, they pair perfectly with fresh toppings like whipped cream or fruit, making every bite a sweet indulgence.

name: Waterzooi
short_description: Originating from Ghent, this creamy Belgian stew combines tender chicken with vibrant vegetables like potatoes, carrots, and celery. Slow-cooked to perfection, it delivers a comforting, rich flavor in every spoonful.

name: Mitraillette
short_description: Originating from Brussels or Wallonia, this hearty sandwich features a crusty baguette stuffed with succulent fries, savory meats, and zesty sauces, capturing the essence of Belgian street food culture.

name: Chicon au gratin
short_description: Braised Belgian endives are wrapped in savory ham, smothered in creamy white sauce, and baked to perfection with a golden Gruyère crust. A cozy classic that embodies Belgium’s love for rich flavors!

name: Boulets sauce lapin à la Liègeoise
short_description: Belgium's beloved boulets sauce lapin à la Liègeoise features tender beef and pork meatballs simmered in a rich, flavorful gravy with sweet sirop de Liège and sultanas, offering a comforting taste of tradition.

name: Stoemp
short_description: A beloved Belgian side dish, stoemp features creamy mashed potatoes blended with vibrant vegetables like leeks, carrots, and Brussels sprouts. Its comforting flavors make it a perfect accompaniment to hearty meats.

name: Filet Americain
short_description: Originating from Belgium, this savory spread features finely ground raw beef mixed with Worcestershire sauce, onions, and capers. It's a flavorful twist on steak tartare, perfect for adventurous palates.

name: Sneeuwballen
short_description: Indulge in these seasonal Belgian delights, featuring a fluffy vanilla core wrapped in rich dark chocolate and dusted with cocoa. A perfect blend of creaminess and decadence, they are a must-try from September to March!

name: Bicky Burger
short_description: A beloved Belgian classic, the Bicky Burger features a crispy, deep-fried patty of pork, chicken, and horse meat, all nestled in a sesame seed bun. Its savory blend of flavors and satisfying crunch make it a must-try street food delight.

name: Cougnou
short_description: Originating from Belgium, this sweet, brioche-like bread features a rich, yeasted dough often studded with raisins or chocolate chips and topped with crunchy pearl sugar. Perfect for festive occasions, each bite is a delightful blend of warmth and sweetness.

name: Preisoep
short_description: Belgium's beloved Flemish leek soup warms hearts with its creamy blend of tender leeks and potatoes, simmered in rich beef and vegetable stock, perfect for chilly days. Enjoy a bowl of comfort!

name: Antwerpse handjes
short_description: Originating from Antwerp in 1934, these delightful hand-shaped cookies blend rich butter, sweet sugar, and nutty almonds for a melt-in-your-mouth experience. Perfect with coffee or as a sweet souvenir!

name: La dame blanche
short_description: Originating from Belgium, this delightful dessert layers creamy vanilla gelato with fluffy whipped cream, all drizzled in rich, warm chocolate fudge for a decadent treat.

name: Gaufres à la flamande
short_description: Indulge in the rich, buttery essence of Flemish waffles, a beloved Belgian treat. Lightly crisped and subtly sweet, they shine in their simplicity, making them a perfect snack any time of day.

name: Geraardsbergse mattentaart
short_description: Originating from East Flanders, this delightful sweet pie features a flaky puff pastry enveloping a creamy, almond-infused cheese curd filling. Each bite offers a perfect balance of richness and sweetness.

name: Lacquemant wafel
short_description: Originating from Liège, the Lacquemant wafel delights with its thin, buttery exterior, filled with a fragrant orange blossom sugar syrup. A true Belgian treat that's perfect for indulgence!

name: Croquettes de crevettes
short_description: Belgian croquettes de crevettes deliver a delightful crunch, encasing a creamy blend of North Sea brown shrimp in crispy breadcrumbs. A beloved local treat, they capture the essence of seaside flavors.

name: Paling in 't groen
short_description: Chopped eel simmers in a vibrant green sauce of herbs and white wine, delivering a fresh, savory taste that embodies Flemish culinary tradition. Rich butter and shallots enhance each bite.

name: Vitoulet
short_description: Belgian Vitoulet delights with a blend of ground veal and pork, enriched with breadcrumbs and a hint of shallots. Savory and tender, these meatballs are a cherished comfort food, perfect for any occasion.

name: Moules parquées
short_description: Originating from Brussels, these raw mussels on the half-shell are a delightful treat. Dressed with zesty lemon juice, tangy mustard, and a hint of black pepper, they offer a refreshing taste of Belgium's culinary heritage.

name: Asperges á la Flamande
short_description: Cooked white asparagus is elegantly topped with a rich blend of mashed hard-boiled eggs, creamy butter, zesty lemon juice, and fresh parsley. A beloved Flemish classic, it celebrates spring's bounty.

name: Kramiek
short_description: Originating from Belgium, this delightful sweet bread features a soft, buttery dough studded with plump raisins. Perfect for breakfast or a snack, it offers a comforting blend of sweetness and warmth.

name: Tarte al d'jote
short_description: Originating from Nivelles, Tarte al d'jote blends creamy cow's milk cheese with vibrant chard and savory onions. Baked to golden perfection, it offers a rich, comforting taste of Belgian tradition.

name: Tomate crevette
short_description: A classic Belgian appetizer, an uncooked tomato bursts with flavor, filled with tender Nordseekrabben, creamy mayonnaise, zesty lemon juice, and fresh parsley. Perfectly refreshing!

name: Lapin á la Kriek
short_description: Tender rabbit simmers in a luscious sauce of Kriek lambic beer and sweet cherries, elevated with a hint of cinnamon and shallots. A classic Belgian dish that embodies hearty, rustic flavors.

name: Potjevleesch
short_description: A beloved Flemish classic, this hearty meat dish features a savory blend of mutton, lamb, pork, beef, and veal, slow-simmered with onions, wine, and fresh herbs for rich, comforting flavors. Perfect for sharing, it connects diners to Belgium's rich culinary heritage.

name: Couque de Dinant
short_description: Originating from the picturesque town of Dinant, these traditional Belgian cookies are crafted from wheat flour and honey, offering a delightful sweetness. Their signature hard texture makes them a unique treat, enjoyed by all ages.

name: Boudin blanc de Liège
short_description: Savor the rich flavors of Liège's boudin blanc, a traditional Belgian white sausage blending tender pork, creamy milk, and onions. Stuffed in casings and gently cooked, it offers a delightful, savory bite.

name: Galettes Campinoises
short_description: Originating from the Kempen region of Belgium, these delightful galettes feature a crunchy exterior that crumbles into a buttery, vanilla-infused bite, perfect for pairing with coffee or tea.

name: Côte de porc à l'berdouille
short_description: Originating from Mons, Côte de porc à l'berdouille features succulent pork chops simmered in a rich sauce of cream, shallots, and tangy Dijon mustard, creating a comforting, flavor-packed delight.
